intro: Hieracium prenanthoides subsp. subglandulosissimum, commonly known as the glandular hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and flowering heads that produce small, yellowish to reddish flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its glandular hairs, which are more prominent than in other members of the species. It typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. The plant is often found in temperate regions and is noted for its ornamental value in gardens.
